overview_of_class: This course prepares gifted educators to provide local leadership in the design and implementation of school strategies for identifying gifted students, placing students in appropriate service settings, guiding curricular modifications, and using data to monitor individual student growth and guide improvement in school gifted service delivery models. The course will also explore ethical issues in assessment, special considerations in the assessment and identification of culturally, linguistically, and economically diverse students and students with disabilities, and uses and misuses of data related to gifted students school and policy contexts in the era of accountability and data-driven decision making.
name: Designing and Implementing Effective Programs and Services for Advanced Learners
subject: MS_ED
